clauses.question: 1. What process should the Government use to set a new emissions reduction target in legislation?
clauses.notes: There should be no emissions reduction target in legislation

clauses.question: 2. If the Government sets a 2050 target now, which is the best target for New Zealand?
3. How should New Zealand meet its targets?
clauses.notes: Targets should be aspirational encouraged by incentives if necessary

clauses.question: 4. Should the Zero Carbon Bill allow the 2050 target to be revised if circumstances change?
5. The Government proposes that three emissions budgets of five years each (i.e. covering the next 15 years) be in place at any given time. Do you agree with this proposal?
clauses.notes:
Govt enforced budgets are a costly answer to a problem that probably doesn't exist. Increased atmospheric carbon so far has been

 beneficial to plant growth and food production. Harmful effects are hyped up by politicians promoting their own ideology.

clauses.question: 6. Should the Government be able to alter the last emissions budget (i.e. furthest into the future)?
7. Should the Government have the ability to review and adjust the second emissions budget within a specific range under exceptional circumstances? See p36 Our Climate Your Say
8. Do you agree with the considerations we propose that the Government and the Climate Change Commission take into account when advising on and setting budgets? See p44 Our Climate Your Say
9. Should the Zero Carbon Bill require Governments to set out plans within a certain timeframe to achieve the emissions budgets?
11. The Government has proposed that the Climate Change Commission advises on and monitors New Zealand's progress towards its goals. Do you agree with these functions? See p42 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes: Climate Commission should be able to carry out independent research into global warming threats if any

clauses.question: 12. What role do you think the Climate Change Commission should have in relation to the New Zealand Emissions Trading Scheme (NZ ETS)?
clauses.notes: An emissions trading scheme is a waste of time and money

clauses.question: 14. Do you think the Zero Carbon Bill should cover adapting to climate change?
clauses.notes:
There should be no zero carbon bill. Any thing that NZ does will make no difference to global carbon or climate. The whole process is

a waste of time and merely panders to political ideology and will massively penalise the country.

clauses.question: 15. The Government has proposed a number of new functions to help us adapt to climate change. Do you agree with the proposed functions? See p47 Our Climate Your Say
16. Should we explore setting up a targeted adaptation reporting power that could see some organisations share information on their exposure to climate change risks?
Do you have any other comments you'd like to make?
clauses.notes:
Climate change is a natural process that mankind has only a marginal effect upon. Until real evidence emerges of detrimental effects,

rather than computer models that have been proven to give major overestimates of warming, no legislative action should be taken,
other than aspirational.
